content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Resource Depot & Smelting Facility at base position (x=-4.5, y=18.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Wooden Chest at position (x=-4.5, y=18.5) serving as the central storage depot.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-3.0, y=19.0) used for smelting iron ore into iron plates.
- Stone Furnace at position (x=-4.0, y=21.0) processing copper ore into copper plates.

### Automation Lab & Steam Power System (Integrated System)
Consists of the following entities:
- Lab at position (x=-7.5, y=18.5) configured for automation research.
- Boiler at position (x=-5.5, y=24.0) reporting NO_FUEL with empty fuel inventory.
- Generator (Steam Engine) at position (x=-0.5, y=24.5) not connected to the power network.
- Offshore Pump at position (x=-7.5, y=25.5) operating normally.
- Electricity Group with several small electric poles (e.g., near (x=-0.5, y=11.5), (x=-7.5, y=15.5), (x=-4.5, y=15.5)).
- Pipe Groups forming the fluid network:
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=2984 at (x=-10.5, y=16.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=2985 at (x=-12.5, y=18.5) – EMPTY.
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=2987 at (x=-8.5, y=20.5) – FULL_OUTPUT.
   • PipeGroup with fluid_system=2989 at (x=-2.5, y=21.5) – EMPTY.

### Copper Cable Factory at position (x=1.5, y=19.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- AssemblingMachine1 at position (x=1.5, y=19.5) running the copper-cable recipe (currently not receiving electricity).
- Output Chest at position (x=1.5, y=21.5) handling copper-cable dispatch.
- Dedicated Copper Buffer Chest at position (x=-5.5, y=21.5) holding copper-plate(s).
- Input Supply Chain for AssemblingMachine1:
   • Wooden Chest (input chest) at position (x=1.5, y=17.5) that receives copper plates.
   • Burner Inserter at position (x=3.5, y=17.5) placed adjacent to the input chest, rotated to face RIGHT.
   • Burner Inserter at position (x=2.5, y=17.5) placed adjacent to the input chest, rotated to face RIGHT.
   • Burner Inserter at position (x=0.5, y=17.5) placed adjacent to the input chest, with final orientation set to DOWN.

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────
- Chest Placement and Inventory Verification:
  • When placing wooden chests for input supply, confirm that the target location is clear of collisions. Multiple attempts at positions (0.5, 19.5), (0.5, 18.5), (0.5, 19.0), (-0.5, 19.5), and (1.5, 17.0) failed due to existing objects.
  • Verify that a wooden chest is available in the inventory before attempting placement to avoid “No wooden_chest in inventory” errors.

- Variable Initialization:
  • Ensure that key variables (for example, input_chest and inserter) are defined and initialized before being referenced. Repeated NameError issues indicate that these variables were used prior to assignment.

- Inserter Placement and Orientation:
  • Adjust spacing, direction, and reference positions when positioning burner inserters next to input chests. Errors occurred when attempting to place inserters adjacent to the input chest at (1.5, 17.5) due to collision with nearby entities (such as AssemblingMachine1) or unsuitable terrain.
  • When modifying inserter orientation (e.g., switching from facing LEFT to DOWN), verify that the updated placement still avoids conflicts with surrounding structures.

- Resource Insertion:
  • Check for sufficient resource availability in the inventory (e.g., copper-plate count) before attempting to insert items into chests, as failures were reported when resources were lacking.
